title: Scrolling to fast on opestreetmap.org skips zoom levels
content:
At some point recently the scrolling got to fast and now its skipping one zoom level when zooming in and out.

The only fix I found was to reduce to mouse setting in widows on how many lines to scroll from 3 to 2. Problem is this causes regular web page scrolling to be awfully slow. And it affects other browsers as well.

Anyone know what caused this and if its fixable?

Working perfectly in Edge and Chrome.
creator: jan_tillung

title: The browser always logs me out Discord
content: I disabled clearing the cookies, cache, active logins and site settings when I close the browser but it still logs me out of Discord every time. Please help me fix this.
creator: sarinraj023

title: Problem displaying images
content:
After updating to version 97.0, firefox does not display all images (on websites). I've searched web and all the solutions I found mention to open the security icon (up left -the lock), go to more information - permissions - and "Make sure Allow is selected next to Load Images". But there isn't such an option at permissions.

When I go to media tab (before permissions at the same window) I can download all images of the page (and then I can see them all), but on the website I can see only a few.

Could you please help me?
creator: kotzabasi

title: con win 10 e firefox 97.0 alcuni servizi di bancoposta tipo bonifici non funzionano
content: c'è qualche intervento da fare su impostazioni?
creator: ricbis38

title: Certificate handling
content:
I'm on the latest version of Firefox on Windows 10 and I have three problems:

1. I have removed old identity certificates so I only have two left. I've closed and restarted many days now. But when I access a site that requires a certificate, four appear in the drop-down list to select. There should only be the two that I have.

2. If I don't check the "Remember this decision" box and click "OK", the certificate will not be selected. If I check that box, then it is accepted, but next time I can't select a different certificate for the site, and I have to go to the security settings and delete the decision for the site. That is wrong (see image).

3. I remember at least one site that ignores the certificate selection, and when returning to the app after identity confirmation, it takes me back to start the identification verification process again. These sites work fine in the Edge browser, but not in Firefox.
creator: harryscopic

creator: rodrigo.nazareno1983

title: Win11 WSL2 server not working through localhost only in Firefox
content:
Hello, I am having an issue with Firefox not wanting to open a server I have hosted on my WSL2 Ubuntu instance through localhost.

Edge and Chrome open it just fine.

If I try to open it through the WSL2 IP address (taken from eth0 on ifconfig output in ubuntu) and not through localhost, it works also fine, so there is something not working with localhost only in Firefox.

I tried everything I could find on Google for a week now, nothing seems to work, I refreshed/reinstalled Firefox (even though I deleted the profile folders also, it still knew somehow I am reinstalling cause it said so), I tried removing all the Windows Firewall rules I found in regards with Firefox and re-added one to allow everything from Firefox, still nothing, I reset all the settings in Firefox about:config, still nothing...

I am on Windows 11, this issue started happening a few days after I migrated to Win11, without any changes done to my server in WSL.

I attached some screenshots to show the issue, basically when I try to open the localhost:port (hosted in WSL as I mentioned) it just loads and loads and loads, nothing happens, I even waited 10 min, any other browser works instantly.

In one screenshot below with the hosts files, you will see I added the ipv6 ::1 localhost but I tried without that even and it still does not work.

Any help anyone can give is really appreciated, thanks. Let me know if I should post any other details or screenshots.
creator: leo.cserny

title: errore handshake Google
content:
Da ieri Firefox non mi permette di aprire google.com né fare ricerhe...

title: Resolution of strange server error after upgrade to Mac OS 10.15.7 and subsequent security download
content:
Previously reported denial of account access via password for Hughes.net was resolved by downloading a clean copy of Firefox 97.0 using the most recent .dmg. by using an old Firefox .dmg (version 66.0.2) to create a "clean" version with no add-ons. Erasing the interim version enabled a pristine download to be substituted. Then re-installing both the new Firefox and the previously associated DuckDuckGo add-on overcame the previous bug. It is not known whether the upgrade to OS 10.15.7 itself caused the password entry bug directly with Firefox operation or whether the problem was a combination with the Mac version of DuckDuckGo processing.

It should be noted that 17 other 64 bit third party apps were broken by this MacOS upgrade and had to be reinstalled using previously saved or newly downloaded .dmg files. Most of these other broken apps would not even boot at all. Accident or Planned ?

Either way, thanks for allowing me to vent my fury at Apple on your platform. -D. Meisel, Geneseo,NY
creator: ddmeisel

Grazie

title: Firefox unable to load websites/start up even when uninstalled and reinstalled since latest update
content:
I'm currently on chrome typing this, but I need a way to get firefox working again, there is no specific error message but whenever I reinstall and try to "refresh firefox" either on uninstall or reinstall which removes extensions and other settings, I get a crash and very long error message below. I've tried removing the firefox folder in %appdata% after uninstall and still no dice.

I will also only be able to open firefox once on a fresh reinstall when running it with administrator permissions but then never again until the next uninstall and reinstall. See attached screenshot for what firefox looks like at that point. None of the side buttons work, and I cannot search any websites or click the back/refresh buttons. The only button that does anything is "refresh firefox", but when I click it, Firefox closes, gives a crash message about a minute later, and never opens back up again.

title: Firefox dont't loading video image but still load this audio

creator: ninhtran456

title: Firefox ran stably and reliably till last Friday, has been broken ever since
content:
Since last Friday I have been experiencing an ongoing issue with the Firefox application. Simply put I opened the application and all I saw was a blank screen, I still had the basic format/layout but nothing was coming up including error messages. The weird thing is is that I am experiencing the same issue on both my computer and laptop, both run windows 10 and are up to date on software. I verified that the antivirus/firewall isn't interfering with the application, other web browsers are functioning properly, I have uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox, cookies have been cleared, Firefox has been refreshed, computer restarted, new Firefox profile created, and verified by Webroot and Windows Defender that no malware is present.

I tried troubleshooting more today and I was able to at least get a webpage to load, but if I tried visiting another webpage in that same tab, Firefox would hang up. What allowed me to get a webpage to load (at least the first one) was by disabling the webroot extension. I've attempted to run Firefox with all extensions disabled but I am still having the same issue.

Other features that wont work are tools under the more tools tab, I was able to get the browser console open and took a screenshot of that, hopefully that may shed some light on the issue, any help would be great appreciated, thanks!
creator: michaljunik99

title: Firefox doesn't start and I can't get info to investigate
content:
Hi there,

My Firefox seems to be crashed or freezed. I suspect something about profiles are wrong. But I'm stucked. Would you please give me some helps?

1. Uninstall Firefox. 2. Delete all files in %AppData%\Mozilla\Firefox. 3. Install Firefox again. 4. At first, Firefox starts. - I don't know why, but it says old profile is found. 5. In almost times, Firefox doesn't make access to web pages. - Even if input URL to press Enter, nothing occurs. - Very rarely a web page appears, but not finish loading. 6. Firefox doesn't show about:profile. 7. Firefox doesn't show about:crashes. 8. After the first boot, Firefox doesn't start even if trouble shooting mode. - Very rarely it starts, but can't access either any pages nor about:***. 9. Running "firefox.exe -P" fails, too.

What should I do to use Firefox again?

Best regards,
creator: keeley

title: Firefox Crash at Hughesnet account sign-on after upgrade to Mac OS 10.15 Described as internal server error
content: Folks: After two days of a rather difficult upgrade to Mac OS 10.15 from 10.14 on an older 27 inch iMac, many programs had to be reloaded from .dmg files. Today I downloaded the latest "security" update for Apple for OS 10.15 but since I do not have any "devices" that run IOS, etc. , I declined the accompianying device update. My copy of Firefox for the Mac was regenerated and the same server error was observed. Yet when I used the "new" Safari I could get through to my Hughesnet account information. I hate Safari and have not used it for years, but this is obviously Apple's way of trying to force all Apple users to use it in preference to other browsers. I am hoping you can track this problem down. I would have contacted Hughes support, but since Safari got through, I am sure Hughes support could not help. What is strange is that other than being unable to sign on the account, Firefox behaves normally getting into other sites. You may also be interested to know why I upgraded to 10.14 in the first place when 10.14 was working just fine (again without an iPad or an iPhone (I have neither) associated with the iMac. I was considering switching from Turbotax to HR-Block, but found out that H-R Block's program demanded using Safari ! So after using turbotax for nearly 15 years I went back and found 2021 required an upgrade to OS 10.15. Thus I got caught in a dominoe effect trying to avoid Safari and then Safari comes back to haunt me. How is that for irony ? Anyway best wishes and thanks for whatever you can do if anything. -D. Meisel Geneseo, NY 14454.
creator: ddmeisel

title: Control of Picture in Picture Window
content: Heya! I've enjoyed Firefox for a long time, and I've gotten a lot of use recently of the Picture In Picture window to watch YouTube while I play Black Desert Online. One issue is, though, that while I'm in the game, because it uses mouse to aim, and left click for some attacks, it will pick up the window and move it, which is very inconvenient, as you may imagine! Is there any way that there could be an option or hotkey to disable interactivity with the Picture In Picture windows? No worries if not, I hope you have a fantastic day!

title: 97.0 Can't Save Web page Images via Tools > Page Info > Media > Save As
content:
This is on Version 97.0, latest release, Upgraded on Feb 15, 2022

Web page Image Download via Tools > Page Info > Media > Save As - no longer works as it did in previous versions of Firefox.

Attempting to save any image results in no file saved.

How to Duplicate Note: Download setting is set to: Always ask you where to save files

1. Go to new tab (My default is Firefox home) 2. Select from tool bar Tools > Page Info > Media 3. Select any image in the list (it will give you a preview) 4. Select the Save As button 5. Windows directory screen will ask you to choose the directory 6. Select Save As Results: Windows directory screen will disappear as if the file was saved, but checking the directory reveals that no file was saved.

This was supposedly fixed in Bug 1683244 ( https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1683244 ) but it seems to have reappeared.
creator: w84uhere

title: Firefox will not connect to Amazon.com (nor smile.amazon.com). Error "Secure Connection Failed"
content:
Windows 10 Firefox 97.0 (64 bit) Amazon.com

Suddenly, without any changes I am aware of, Firefox will not connect to Amazon.com (nor smile.amazon.com). I get the error "Secure Connection Failed" followed with "An error occurred during a connection to smile.amazon.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR". All other sites, including banking, seem to be fine. I can connect to Amazon via Edge. What does work, besides Edge, is Firefox's troubleshooting mode. What's disabled in TS mode?

I have tried the following: 1- With and without VPN. 2- Disabled Defender. 3- close everything and restart. 4- Clear cache, cookies, and everything else I could think of then close down and restart. 5- Reinstalled a fresh version of Firefox (and then also cleared cache etc and restarted).

This has been happening just over a week and there was a brief period, a couple days ago, when it connected to Amazon but that did not last. Any thoughts or suggestions? Thanks very much.
creator: vicky11
